fields.description: I created a plan that has 3 jobs. Two of the jobs are configured to use a different source repository from the plan's source repository. I have the plan source repository set to trigger the build by polling the repository every 10 minutes. However, there is no such option for the job source repositories. Therefore, I would assume that job source repositories can trigger a build as set up in the plan's source repository configuration. However, this does not seem to be the case. Changes in the job source repositories never trigger builds. Furthermore, these changes never show up in the Code Changes section of the Build Result Summary.
fields.summary: Job source repository not being polled for changes

fields.summary: Checkout Task throws exception if Source Repositories on Plan are removed

fields.description: Disable the "delete" button for Tasks when saving otherwise it screws up the state. the Cancel should not be available once the deletion is in progress.

fields.summary: HibernateQueryException: could not resolve property: commits of: com.atlassian.bamboo.resultsummary.AbstractResultsSummary

fields.description:
If i check some project dashboard in bamboo, then there is one graphic combo, that doesn't display data, if Group by is changed to something else than "DAY" (or "AUTO" which shows same data as DAY)
Check attached images of working and empty charts.
Let it be known that this project from which i took screenshots has years worth of data.
fields.summary: Successful builds Chart empty for "WEEK" and "MONTH"

fields.description:
like on this result: [http://tardigrade.sydney.atlassian.com:8085/bamboo/browse/BAM-FC-5671]

My commit comment was actually two-line comment. Bamboo concatenates the new-line characters and display my comment as a one-line comment. That's not looking good (at least to me)
fields.summary: Commit messages should preserve new lines in commit summary screen

fields.description: Send call is blocking. When it's called, Bamboo tries to connect to the IM server. If that takes a long time to finish, the thread pool for event distribution will rapidly become depleted. We've seen delays of 30 minutes in event distribution on customer installations.
fields.summary: Wrong configuration of IM can disable event system

fields.description: Might need some direction from Jens
fields.summary: In the repository title on the Plan configuration view show url of repository

fields.description: It would be nice if there would be a possibility to "record" log4j sockets. For example in a job there would be an artefact definition "log4j socket recorder". The job would "record" all content which is delivered through the socket while the job runs. If this job would deploy a web application it could get the logs from the server (e.g. tomcat).
fields.summary: Log4j socket recorder
JavaScript error in the admin section related to UPM

fields.description:
h4. Problem
Currently we include test case failure in the logs, but there is no indication as to why the build failed - if its due build errors.

h4. Suggested improvement
(Optionally) include the full errors of the build in the notification e-mails so that users would not have to log in to Bamboo to diagnose the issue. Embed the *Error summary* contents in the notification that is sent out.
fields.summary: Include standard error logs in Email notifications when builds fail

fields.description: Currently we include test case failure in the logs, but there is no indication as to why the build failed - if its due build errors.
fields.summary: Include standard error logs in Email notifications when builds fail

fields.description:
The Dashboard plan list displays a small balloon icon on the right side of the build number if a build has a comment (see screen shot).

However, if a new build is run, the comment from the old build will still be displayed.

Users using the comment to provide extra information about a build on the Dashboard would be seeing old comments for new build numbers. 

If the build does not have a comment yet, the balloon icon should be hidden.
fields.summary: Dashboard comment icon is not updated when a new build is run

fields.description:
It is no longer necessary to keep the i18n files for other languages in the source tree, now TAC is able to generate languages packs that contain the translation for jira-core and its bundled plugins.

We should now only have the english i18n file in source.
fields.summary: Removal of the french and german i18n keys for the jira bamboo plugin

fields.description: Let's add a thicker line between the default repository and other repository on a plan as well as add a (default) marker after the repository name.
fields.summary: Mark default repository in list clearly

fields.description:
Similar to Final Tasks, which can run at the end of every plan.
There should be a Final Stage which is executed at the end of plan execution regardless of outcome
fields.summary: Final Stage for plans

fields.description: This is necessary, specially for Studio customers. The old agent and agent home-dir need to be removed.
fields.summary: Document how an EC2 Agent upgreade can be performed

fields.description:
due to: [BSP-5375 (Maven Dependencies Processor does not work with repository isolation)|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/BSP-5375]

${bamboo.agentId} should evaluate to the same value as used in [Maven Repository Isolation|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Configuring+Repository+Isolation+for+Maven+Executables] feature.
fields.summary: Allow to use ${bamboo.agentId} substitution during builds.

fields.description:
For default repository as currently
For others:
repository.[data].repository_name
fields.summary: Store metadata for repository for multiple repositories

fields.description:
We should add some additional Text that explains to users how to add more repositories to the Plan and link to the plan configuration.

"You can check out one or more repositories with this Task. You can choose to check out the Plan's Default Repository or specify a Specific Repository. You can add additional repositories to this Plan via the Plan Configuration."
fields.summary: Make it more clear to users how to add additional repositories to the Plan from the Task View.

fields.description:
There seems to be some sort of pool exhaustion issue that [a Studio customer has hit|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-24760] where the system deadlocks. Thread dumps show hundreds of threads that look like they're waiting for database connections, with nothing obviously running that would free them. The log contains hours of messages from the {{PreventJobExecutionUntilCompletedTriggerListener}} about refusing to start a new job due to an increasingly old job (triggered by {{DEFAULT.elasticAgentMonitorJobTrigger}}) still going. Situation persisted for several hours until the customer noticed and got support to restart Bamboo.

Log which includes two thread dumps attached.
fields.summary: Database pool exhaustion leading to deadlock

fields.description: We often look through long logs to resolve issues. We use the timestamp field to position, but it would be convenient to have a line number to easily reference a specific line and get a better understanding of where you are in the listing. For example, I would like to say: go look at line number 98765 in build xxx. Better yet, make it possible to url a specific line number.

fields.description:

# Pull to cache
# Clone to working dir . The directory exists, it's already checked out -> failure
# Remove working directory
# Clone to working dir again.

Why doesn't it just pull to cache and then from cache? Maybe the EBS contains a faulty working dir?

fields.summary: Job results not removed when job is deleted from plan

fields.description:
NCover is supported in Bamboo. However its a bare minimum implementation. There is no support for trend files. Bamboo should ask for the location of a trend file and keep it from build to build. I know I can do this by putting it onto a share and using in each build. But that means I have to setup a share per plan!
It would be much better if I could save a trend file as a type of shared artifact and use it across builds.

Also the display of NCover results should be improved. NCover offers a very rich report and Bamboo only uses the bare minimum.
fields.summary: NCover support needs to be improved

fields.description: It would be great if could download a ready-to-use installation package for Debian/Ubuntu - a .deb file.
fields.summary: Bamboo distributed as .deb Debian/Ubuntu packages

fields.description:
We often have to download artifacts after a build. Often these are around 10 or 20 files.

It would be nice if there was a button on the artifact view page to download all as a zip.

fields.summary: Exception when writing repository data
Mac OS X Startup Item for Bamboo
Remove @RequiresRestart from build related module descriptors

fields.description:
Our build chain sometimes cannot proceed because a post plugin crashed. Instead of marking the plan red which caused the error, the next plan turns red with an unknown exception. 

For example : 
Stage A should provide an artifact which is used by Stage B. Unfortunately, the responsible Job in Stage A threw {code}	Failed to execute plugin 'Artifact Copier' with error: java.io.IOException: Unexpected HTTP status code: 500 Internal Server Error{code}, but the keyword "Build Success" was found, so the job is green. The next job in Stage B runs into {code}Failure in artifact preparation phase during processing of: Subscription for Shared artifact: [abc123], pattern: [abc123] anchored at[.], destination: []
1 error(s) found when performing pre-build actions. {code}

Could you let the first job fail so that the Stage B isn't triggered at all?
fields.summary: Artifact producing plan doesn't fail when artifact not copied

fields.description:
The bamboo gadget is not displaying correctly on the wallboard.
Two screenshots are attached.
The first (good) shows bamboo running correctly, the second (bad) shows it in error on account of the issue statistics gadget being on the same screen - it it not colouring the gadget correctly when on the wallboard.

Checked in JIRA 4.3.4 and Bamboos 3.1.4 and 3.1 - Wallbaord plugin 1.6.3
fields.summary: Bamboo Gadget Displays Incorrectly on Wallboard (no coloration)

fields.description:
When attempting to configure a test instance of Bamboo 3.2 with OAuth support for a remote Jira instance, I'm not able to access the OAuth config page. Behind the scenes Bamboo is generating invalid http:// URLs when it should be using https://. The source for the OAuth tab shows the issue {code:html}
This application Atlassian Bamboo - TEST INSTANCE (Bamboo) can be configured to allow incoming requests from xxx(JIRA) using these authentication methods:
  • Trusted Applications
  • OAuth
  • Basic Access
{code} As you can see above most URLs are generated with the correct https:// URL prefix. However, the URLS for the * trustedAppsAuthenticationProviderPluginModule * OAuthAuthenticatorProviderPluginModule ,iFrames are using http:// prefixes. The BasicAuthenticationProviderPluginModule tab is behaving correctly. We've never got Bamboo gadgets working properly in Confluence and Jira, and now we can't even configure the OAuth access in Bamboo itself! Can you guys re-work the internals of the plugin modules in question so that you always adhere to the Base URL for the application? We see this issue in the "Basic Access" tab for outgoing requests and the "Trusted Applications" and "OAuth" tabs for incoming. I'm attaching a screenshot demonstrating what we're seeing in Chrome when the issue happens.
fields.summary: Bamboo OAuth support broken when running Bamboo over https

fields.description: as in summary, to verify

fields.description:
Due to a yet unknown problem, I've got some build-nodes that seem to go off-line randomly during a build.

However, when you look at current activity, there are no indicators, as the build does not complete. This should be considered a failure, or at least show up in the current dashboard.
fields.summary: When a build does not complete, because the node goes offline, it'd be good to see that in the Current activity "recently completed" summary

Renaming the Bamboo-Artifactory plugin from {{bamboo-artifactory-plugin-1.4.1.jar}} to {{bamboo-artifactory-plugin.jar}} solves the issue.
The plugin is of type 1 and doesn't utilize OSGi, but it seems as though the version in the file name somehow affects its interaction with the UPM.
fields.summary: Bamboo-Artifactory plugin clashes with the UPM
Test (and fix is required) agent and server wrapper with openjdk7

This happened for two separate and widely-used labels.
It was pretty obvious from the hibernate exception that Bamboo had created duplicate labels in the DB.
We ended up renaming the duplicate label and telling any builds that referenced it to use the original label.
The relevant database contents prior to the fix were as follows:

We hit a very similar issue with a plan creation race condition (BAM-9231) recently. 
This appears to be caused by a separate race condition affecting the creation of labels.
fields.summary: Possible race condition for build label addition
Build trigger is not set on upgrade to multiple repositories - so change detection does not work

fields.description: Currently, going into source repo edition page to see it
fields.summary: Show build trigger marker on chain configuration view
Handle multiple repositories in commit view, commit summary view and result summary view

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1) go [here|http://tardigrade.sydney.atlassian.com:8085/bamboo/chain/admin/config/editChainRepository.action?buildKey=BAMPLUGINSCORE-BRMP]
2) wait till "Subversion" repository configuration loads (on the right side)
3) click "Save Repository" (on the right)
4a) you will get red {color:red}"This is not a valid Subversion Repository: svn: Authentication required for '<https://studio.atlassian.com:443> Subversion Repository'"{color}
4b) while I expected the repository will be saved with no problems
fields.summary: editing existing Subversion repository doesn't pass the validation

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1) go to some plan source repository configuration
2) click 'add repository'
3a) set repository name, for example "aaa"
3) on the right: from the list select Mercurial repository
4) set repository URL to something like "aaa" (doesn't matter in this test-case)
5) select from "Web Repository" -> "Mercurial Web Repository" (you can leave the sub-select default)
6) click 'save repository' (on the right)
7) click again on "source repository" tab (like you would like to edit the plan
8a) there is no new repository - it disappeared
8b) while I expected it will wait for me there, my new "aaa" repository.

(note: if I don't select the Web Repository for that new repository -> all is good, I have my 'aaa" repo)
fields.summary: Bamboo doesn't save created Mercurial repository if WebRepository is used. It just discard the repository.

fields.description:
Currently, if Bamboo integrated with LDAP using the atlassian-user.xml with the LDAP repository cache is set to false example shown below:

fields.description:
We have a bamboo plan for our "release" which runs the maven-release-plugin to actually release our software.  We define the plan with two plan variables: "thisVersion" and "nextVersion".  

Steps to reproduce:
# Go to a JIRA version for the project we want to release, go to the "release" tab, and click to release this JIRA version using the bamboo release plugin
# select "release with new build" and choose the correct bamboo plan (the release plan with the custom variables)
# Click the link to type a value for the variable "thisVersion" and enter a value of 1.1.0
# Click the link to type a value for the variable "nextVersion" and enter a value of 1.2.0.M1-SNAPSHOT
# Click Release
\\
The plan will fire.  If the plan fails, then it is displayed as failing in JIRA and there is a button to "retry"
\\
# Click Retry and the same release plugin popup will be displayed with the previously selected values already filled out except for these problems:

* *while there are two rows for each of the two plan variables we previously input, the variable name in the dropdown is the same for each*.  It lists both variable names as "nextVersion", even though we originally selected the drop downs as "thisVersion" for the first, and "nextVersion" for the second.
** Note that the correct values, however, are still present in the text boxes.  Thus when you see the screen (and I forgot to get a screenshot) you see in the first row a select box with "nextVersion" but with a value of 1.1.0.  And the second row has (again) "nextVersion" in the drop down and the text box value of 1.2.0.M1-SNAPSHOT.  Thus, it persisted the text box values correctly but not the drop down selections correctly.
* If you only change the value of the first drop down -- i.e. change the first drop down from "nextVersion" to "thisVersion" (which is how we originally filled it out) and don't touch the second drop down box at all -- then it will _only_ set the "thisVersion" plan variable (the drop down that we physically clicked and changed).  It will _not_ submit the "nextVersion" variable value to the plan, despite appearing exactly as it did when we originally filled out the form.

This of course made my plan fail a second time as the maven-release plugin needs the "nextVersion" value, and since I don't have a default maven fails because the next version is "" (empty string).

I went back to the Jira Version -> release page and "retried" a third time.  Again I was presented with a form that had both drop downs displayed as "nextVersion".  I clicked the first row drop down and changed it to to the correct "thisVersion" variable.  Then I clicked the second row (currently "nextVersion"), deliberately changed it to "thisVersion" and then clicked again to change it back to "nextVersion".  I left the text box values alone -- as they were already correct.

I submitted this and it worked perfectly.

Thus, by clicking the second row dropdown and changing it and changing it back is a valid workaround.  This seems pretty minor as there is an easy workaround and it seems to only be a problem whenever a release build fails, which is probably rare.
fields.summary: When retrying a release with the release management plugin, default plan variables displayed are not used in the build

fields.description:
Currently, for our projects we have two plans for each: a snapshot plan which detects SVN changes and builds automatically and a release plan which invokes the maven release process.  The maven release plan uses two plan variables to indicate the "current version" being released and the "next" version which are then fed into the release:prepare goal for maven to use.  This works wonderfully.

As a minor improvement it would be nice to _require_ the user to run a parameterized plan, specifying the values for these plan variables.  For this kind of plan, it is _invalid_ to run automatically -- it must require new values to be input whenever the plan is run.  Thus, it would be nice to have first class support from bamboo to prevent someone from running the automated plan accidentally with blank values for the variables.

The risk impact of running a plan with blank variables is very low as the maven:release plugin validates these early in the build process, but this is kind of a nice-to-have feature of Bamboo I think.
fields.summary: Allow plans to _require_ global or plan variables to be defined

!Wrong_AWS_ID.png!

fields.description:
Use case:

*Plan 1:* Run Unit Tests and Coverage
Plan 1 - Stage 1: Run Unit Tests
Plan 1 - Stage 2: Run Coverage

*Plan 2:* Run Functional Tests

Plan 2 would be able to depend on Plan 1 - Stage 1, Plan 2 does not need the Coverage stage to be successful in order to run its Functional Tests.
fields.summary: Allow dependecy between Stages from different Plans

fields.description:
After we upgraded from 2.6.3 to 3.1.4 we had major issues with Bamboo swamping the DB connection pool.
We had no issues with Bamboo 2.6.3, so we didn't expect any with 3.1.4.

Today we hit 295 simultaneous requests to the Bamboo server, having already first increased our limit to 300.
Now we've got to increase the connection pool size limit again to 450-500 just to be sure.

We need an idea of some basic worst case scenarios that should allow us to estimate the max concurrent DB connection usage.
This should take into account the number of local/remote agents, build concurrency and a sample number of active users.
I'm guessing things like wallboards should also be taken into account.

A relevant support case is BSP-4978
fields.summary: Improve the documentation around DB connection limits for large Bamboo instances

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently it's not possible to change the plan and job keys for a project. It is very annoying not to be able to fix an incorrect key when creating a new project or job.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow administrators to change plan and job keys. 
 
h3. Workaround 
Rename the project, clone it as a new project with the right key, and delete the old project.
fields.summary: Allow administrator to change plan and job keys

fields.description: The problem is summarized in [STRM-1715|https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/STRM-1715].  It is caused by the acegi filter kicking out the request to /plugins/servlet/streams when an trying to access it as an anonymous user and anonymous users not having any access.  The OAuth filter should pick up on this and add the OAuth WWW-Authentication headers for clients to be able to figure out how to authenticate, but these headers are only added when a "401 Unauthorized" response is sent.  For some reason, Bamboo is sending a "200 Ok" response instead, so the OAuth headers aren't added and the client has no idea how to authenticate.
fields.summary: OAuth WWW-Auth headers not added to responses from anonymous users when anonymous access is disabled

fields.description:
Currently, the Destination directory option in Artifact Dependency can be left as empty.

This does not work when using Oracle.

Producing artifacts works well, but when a job from a later stage tries to use the artifacts and error occurs.

As Oracle cannot handle storing empty strings, the directory is stored as NULL instead.

It looks like Bamboo fails to deal with NULLs for a destination directory when retrieving and using the value:

{code}
java.lang.NullPointerException
at java.io.File.<init>(File.java:305)
at com.atlassian.bamboo.build.artifact.LocalArtifactManager.retrieve(LocalArtifactManager.java:74)
at com.atlassian.bamboo.build.pipeline.tasks.PrepareBuildTask.prepareArtifacts(PrepareBuildTask.java:100)
at com.atlassian.bamboo.build.pipeline.tasks.PrepareBuildTask.call(PrepareBuildTask.java:50)
{code}

The problem happens during execution of the second stage, even though no actual build action is being performed. The bamboo-home/artifacts directory is present, and the artifact is created correctly.

If the directory the artifact should be referenced from in stage 2 is changed, another nullpointerexception happens:

{code}
2011-08-29 17:14:30,361 ERROR [qtp470279362-11] [FiveOhOh] 500 Exception was thrown.
java.lang.NullPointerException
at com.atlassian.bamboo.ww2.actions.build.admin.config.ConfigureArtifactSubscription.isSubscriptionUnique(ConfigureArtifactSubscription.java:158)
at com.atlassian.bamboo.ww2.actions.build.admin.config.ConfigureArtifactSubscription.validateSubscription(ConfigureArtifactSubscription.java:147)
{code}
fields.summary: Handle empty destination directories correctly for artifacts when using Oracle

fields.description: It would be good if there is an option for user to change the user name in UI.
fields.summary: Ability for user to change user name in UI
Reimplement the handling of externals
Add toolbar buttons for install remote agents and adding local agents to agents screen

fields.description:
It is probably too late now to change, but *buildKey* variable should NOT have been changed! It now results is a *job key* instead according to http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Using+Global,+Plan+or+Build-specific+Variables. A new variable should have been added like *jobKey* or similar. At a minimum, a new variable should be available to get back to the former *buildKey*.  

Looks like docs changed in 3.1, not sure when the code actually changed.

This impacted our bamboo automation after upgrade to 3.2 - although it was fairly minor. Except now we need the old plan key.
fields.summary: buildKey variable not compatible with previous release
Remove legacy SINGLE classloader servlets from Bamboo

fields.description: We use bamboo for critical operations, like releasing, deploy in production, etc. Each one has a corresponding stage. It would be nice if bamboo had a more fine grained security, so that a project lead, for example, is allowed to trigger release stage while a developer isn't.
fields.summary: Have stage permissions

fields.description:
We have a deploy stage that searchs for an ear file in a artifact dir and deploy that ear. The ear is generated by a previous stage and is shared with deploy stage. 

After some builds are triggered, multiple ears are stored in the artifacts folder, so the script doesn't know which one to deploy.

It would be interesing if Bamboo had an option to clear target folder before copying artifacts. As a workaroud we always force a clean build, but this has the side effect of slowing down our builds and we have to reconfigure source repository for that specific stage (we cannot use plan's repository)
fields.summary: Allow to clear target folder before copying artifact

fields.description:
We are using bamboo as a continous delivery tool. Sometimes we need to rollback to a previous version or deploy a previous version in the testing environment (to reproduce some problem, for example). 

Considering we have stages to deploy in testing environment and production, it would be nice for us to rerun a stage from a past build, even if it was successful. 

This would allow us to work with previous versions and rollbacks easily.
fields.summary: Allow to rerun successful stages

fields.description:
When releasing a version in JIRA, you are given the option to select which build to release the version with. However, the drop-down list would only show 25 entries, be it 25 projects or 25 plans.

For example, if you have 5 projects and 6 plans each, then one of the projects is ignored.

This may be due to the limitation of the Rest API coming from Bamboo.

You can test this via these URLs:
* http://BAMBO_SERVER/rest/api/latest/project?expand=projects.project.plans&withBuildPermissionOnly
* http://BAMBO_SERVER/rest/api/latest/project?expand=projects.project.plans
fields.summary: Only 25 Projects/Plans are Shown when Releasing a Version in JIRA

fields.description: The SINGLE classloader cannot be used now that Bamboos bundled plugins are Plugins 2.0. JAR clasloader is now default.
fields.summary: Remove the SINGLE agent classloader switches

fields.description: We would like to buy 50 remote agents. However, you do not have a pricing for it. While this is not stopping our production, it is slowing us from fully utilizing Bamboo and our infrastructure for it.
fields.summary: 50 remote agent license

fields.description:
Today we experienced an issue where our Bamboo server ran out of disk space.
It came to our attention due to to the fact that all of the remote agents went offline at the same time.
We had set up the agent wrapper.conf to continue to try and reconnect to the server for 6 hours after an initial connection failure.
When the server ran out of disk space we saw the following in the agent logs:

INFO   | jvm 2    | 2011/08/25 04:29:09 |       at com.atlassian.bamboo.v2.build.agent.remote.RemoteAgent.start(RemoteAgent.java:52)
INFO   | jvm 2    | 2011/08/25 04:29:09 |       at com.atlassian.bamboo.agent.bootstrap.AgentRunner.run(AgentRunner.java:21)
INFO   | jvm 2    | 2011/08/25 04:29:09 |       at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:662)
ERROR  | wrapper  | 2011/08/25 04:29:09 | JVM exited unexpectedly.
{noformat}

It was only when we restarted the server that the agents reconnected successfully (we didn't restart any of the agents).

It seems that when the disk space error occurred and the agents all took themselves offline, Bamboo made it impossible for them to come back online even though they were trying continuously to do so. This seems like a bug relating to Bamboo's management of connection state for the remote agents.
fields.summary: Remote agents cannot recover from server disk space error without server restart

fields.description:
If you have two links to Bamboo and you have a project that points to the non-default App Link, this will not be respected on a restart.

You need to go to the Bamboo config screen and resave the configuration for it work again
fields.summary: On restart non default project -> Bamboo servers links aren't used
